description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2013Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The final report for the time period 1 January 2011 to March 31 2014 summarises the results of the specific period. The results show that the programme has strengthened the strategic institutions involved, in relation to the overall objective. 1) Examples of results related to the objective "To strengthen the Chinese procuratorate´s capacity to perform its function in accordance with international human rights standards" - Between 2004-2013 RWI supported the first and the only institutionalized and systematic human rights training system within the procuratorate; in total 37 prosecutors at the national level NPrC and nine province-level branch colleges were trained as human rights educators. -The human rights knowledge and teaching skills of approximately 15 core prosecutors have continuously improved. - The human rights textbook from 2010 was updated in accordance with China´s revised Criminal procedure Law. The textbook is accessible for prosecutors over the country through a website. - Since the establishment of the juvenile prosecution division at Haidian District People´s Procuratorate (HDPP) in 2010 its aim has been to exert leniency for juveniles when possible. Statistics show that the pre-trial detention rate for juveniles has continuously dropped during the past few years from 80% (in 2009) to about 50 % (2013). 2) Examples of results related to the objective: To strenghten the institutional capacity of key academic partners to carry out human rights education, research and outreach activities - Improved ability of approximately 30 partner academics at 5 key institutions to initiate and strengthen human rights education at their respective institutions - Several of RWI´s academic contacts have been actively involved in the drafting of China´s National Human Righs Action Plan (2012-2015) -After implementing the RWI and PULS/RHCR joint Master programme in Human Rights for 10 years over 200 students have graduated - In March of 2013 a reference book on human rights teaching Selected Material on Human Rights Law Teaching was published and provided human rights teachers with information on the main UN human rights conventions, and is frequently used by human rights scholars in China. - Human rights teachers across China are benefitting from RWI’s support to PULS/RCHR: experts from PULS/RCHR were used in many of the trainings at western universities and at all of the outreach trainings that they organised for other universities and colleges in their province. 3) Results related to the objective of promoting the establishment of a National Human Rights Institution. Several persons have benefitted from the NHRI related activities and the reception and awareness toward NHRI topics have increased as seen through the levels of attendance for example at the summer school and the numbers of human rights publications printed and distributed. The willingness of relevant stakeholders including the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the State Council Information Office, to engage themselves with the topic of NHRI stems from the efforts made under this project to mainstream the topic. - Altogether 326 students have graduated from the CUPL Optional Summer School and demand has exceeded the available places on the programme. Due to the political context, it is not realistic to expect an NHRI to be established in the near future, however, the activities have spured debate, discussions and interest towards the establishment of an NHRI.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
